tweets.text: @SimonTagg @EnvAgencyMids @StinkStopthe It is my understanding that a public update is now expected tomorrow - https://t.co/ws4eSJf4Ll

@StinkStopthe the residents from Newcastle Under Lyme are suffering daily as a result of obnoxious gas odours pouring into the atmosphere from Whalley‚Äôs Quarry & into their homes & schools. We need your immediate help and a full enquiry to discover why @StinkStopthe @EnvAgency

@SimonTagg @EnvAgencyMids @AaronBell4NUL @StinkStopthe Minor breach, wells disconnected, then they go home for weekend leaving us unable to breathe, so evacuate us to where we can breathe & send them the bill, who allowed stinking landfill to become stinking garbage mountain, how high is it going will we even see NuL from Keele Bank?

@Sian29337182 @StinkStopthe @RedIndustries2 @DefraGovUK @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids It‚Äôs literally like living in a slum isn‚Äôt it, I really feel for the people in those houses. My husband who has the constitution of an ox has been down there twice for work reasons & said the fumes are so strong down there they made him gag #slumbritain #wewillnotbesilent

@EnvAgency This cannot be on the same level as 1000‚Äôs experiencing the toxic affects of a landfill that is 5 minutes from there homes. Why are you not addressing the situation at Whalley‚Äôs quarry. @ClareDinnisEA @StinkStopthe  STOP THE STINK landfills do not belong in a residential area...

@ChrisBaingerEA @EnvAgency Already done. In this instance the organisation responsible for this pass has also been contacted. This information is vital for others who will come across blocked passes across the country, so thank you!

Over six years ago we predicted HS2 would make their application to @EnvAgency to approve tunnelling at the last moment and sure enough they have. Why did they do this? purely to avoid public scrutiny of this highly dubious activity that puts rivers and drinking water at risk.

tweets.text: Do you live/work in the River Leen catchment, Nottingham? If so we'd be keen to find out what you think of the river & it‚Äôs green corridor. Please access our short online survey https://t.co/ypB4SJV0mn @UoNGeography @NottsBAG @SallyLongford @MyNottingham @CN2028 @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/Q0EF2U9Aqt

Our green spaces include our #rivers & #canals. They are special places for us all to enjoy. Today the team deployed as part of #OpClampDown9 with local police, @EnvAgencySW Fishery Enforcement, @AnglingTrust Volunteer Bailiffs & @PoliceDrones to help tackle illegal fishing & ASB https://t.co/bKwYi1BWWg

tweets.text: @PJennings88 @EnvAgency Is there a link to the application or is it the normal restriction of ‚ÄúYou have to make an appointment to visit the local EA office to view the application‚Äù?

We‚Äôve delivered our largest ever programme of #flood and coastal defence improvements!

Working with partners, we‚Äôve helped protect over 300,000 homes from flooding and supported communities to become more resilient to #ClimateChange

Read more: https://t.co/5Bgax4pg9n

#FCERM https://t.co/mS2pKBFb18

Understand the @EnvAgency have received an application from HS2 to approve the environmental permit to allow them to start tunnelling. We are told by the @EnvAgency that this is not be open for consultancy even through there is significant risk to our rivers and water supply.
A real concern that the @EnvAgency approval for HS2 Tunnelling will be pushed through without adequate scrutiny. https://t.co/b5o9gOr7mR

It been over a week since @EnvAgencyMids did a bit of ‚Äòinstructing‚Äô and there ate still significant foul odour plumes coming from this landfill. When will they  provide an update on the action they intend to take? @AaronBell4NUL @StinkStopthe https://t.co/9nC0Sg0cWc

@cain_karlene @Cap_it_off @RedIndustries2 @StinkStopthe @EnvAgencyMids @NewsNBC @StaffordshireCC @SimonTagg @AaronBell4NUL @JamesBevanEA @EmmaHowardBoyd @ClareDinnisEA Why are Environment agency scared of red industries, why aren't public health England involved. When stink comes tonight & I ring 0800 807060 I want to be evacuated to a place I can breathe clean air not toxic fumes, Basford bank closing cos pollution, what about Silverdale Rd?

@Cap_it_off @RedIndustries2 @StinkStopthe @EnvAgencyMids @NewsNBC @StaffordshireCC @SimonTagg @AaronBell4NUL Breach after breach... @JamesBevanEA @EmmaHowardBoyd @ClareDinnisEA  time to see some regulating @StinkStopthe @SimonTagg @

This shocking picture is a yard filled with illegally dumped construction and demolition waste. #WasteCrime harms our environment and economy. Make sure you dispose of construction waste legally, or risk being fined up to ¬£50,000 or face jail.

Read more: https://t.co/wMYPlu9tFt https://t.co/jE9enBIM9Z

And while that is being done let‚Äôs look up the definition of ‚Äògaslighting‚Äô. At risk of repeating myself: maybe we will hear something from @EnvAgencyMids about this.. maybe.. perhaps.. @StinkStopthe @AaronBell4NUL https://t.co/a4iieCmjb3

@WildHorizons_ @KirstyGibbs11 @PJennings88 @EnvAgency @HS2ltd @RobBAylesbury @MATatBucks @WCL_News @WildlifeTrusts @BBOWT @RSBenwell @CraigBennett3 @ChilternSociety @ChilternsAONB @DrElaineKing @gregsmith_uk @CherylGillan Done.
What a day! Such a treat to see brook lamprey spawning today in the Torridge @EnvAgencySW. Counted more than 20! https://t.co/tBCcVdvGC1

@WildHorizons_ @PJennings88 Well done for highlighting this Jim. Have they already been at it elsewhere? I received these photos from a friend near Tring a month or so ago showing pollution, presumably from HS2 disturbance, on a local chalk stream https://t.co/YnUdb61zS9

@IanSnakeGeek @networkrail @EnvAgencySE - can someone please tell me what procedures are in place for notification of works to ensure wildlife is protected when this sort of work is planned by organisations? Is there a wildlife assessment completed? Please reply before I request information under FOI?

For those concerned about the risk to the chalk aquifer  caused by HS2 tunnelling we need access to see the details the environmental approval application lodged with the @EnvAgency recently. The contact email would be enquiries@environment-agency.gov.uk.

Dirty water from our homes should go to a water treatment works not into our rivers or seas. Wrongly connected pipes cause pollution and harm wildlife. Make sure you @connectrightUK #NationalDrainageMisconnectionDay #BinIt4Beaches #RainDownTheDrain. https://t.co/PLaKsIqCVi
Newcastle Borough Council says it wants to see all the firm's findings so it can have them looked at https://t.co/HjOMEFwGK5
